name: monolithically
content:

in a way that relates to something large whose parts are all the same or all behave in the same way: There is a view that Hollywood is monolithically liberal in its political leanings. The entire industry monolithically markets a dangerous product instead of competing to make a safer product. See
monolithic
More examplesFewer examplesThe laws have addressed the issue of copyright on the Internet monolithically.The view is by no means monolithically positive.We don't believe that any particular religious group in America votes monolithically or as a block.
